verses.verse: When Mordecai<WH4782> learned<WH3045> all<WH3605> that had been done,<WH6213> he tore<WH7167> his clothes,<WH899> put<WH3847> on sackcloth<WH8242> and ashes,<WH665> and went<WH3318> out into the midst<WH8432> of the city<WH5892> and wailed<WH2199> loudly<WH1419> and bitterly.<WH4751>
And he went<WH935> as far<WH5704> as the king's gate,<WH8179> for no<WH369> one<WH369> was to enter<WH935> the king's gate<WH8179> clothed<WH3830> in sackcloth.<WH8242>

And in each<WH4082> and every<WH3605> province<WH4082> where<WH4725> <WH834> the command<WH1697> and decree<WH1881> of the king<WH4428> came,<WH5060> there was great<WH1419> mourning<WH60> among the Jews,<WH3064> with fasting,<WH6685> weeping,<WH1065> and wailing;<WH4553> and many<WH7227> lay<WH3331> on sackcloth<WH8242> and ashes.<WH665>

Then Esther's maidens<WH5291> and her eunuchs<WH5631> came<WH935> and told<WH5046> her, and the queen<WH4436> writhed<WH9123> in great<WH3966> anguish. And she sent<WH7971> garments<WH899> to clothe<WH3847> Mordecai<WH4782> that he might remove<WH5493> his sackcloth<WH8242> from him, but he did not accept<WH6901> [them.]

Then Esther<WH635> summoned<WH7121> Hathach<WH2047> from the king's eunuchs,<WH5631> whom<WH834> the king had appointed<WH5975> to attend<WH6440> her, and ordered<WH6680> him [to go] to Mordecai<WH4782> to learn<WH3045> what<WH4100> this<WH2088> [was] and why<WH4100> it [was.]
So Hathach<WH2047> went<WH3318> out to Mordecai<WH4782> to the city<WH5892> square<WH7339> in front<WH6440> of the king's gate.<WH8179>

And Mordecai<WH4782> told<WH5046> him all<WH3605> that had happened<WH7136> to him, and the exact<WH6575> amount<WH6575> of money<WH3701> that Haman<WH2001> had promised<WH559> to pay<WH8254> to the king's treasuries<WH1595> for the destruction of the Jews.<WH6>

He also gave<WH5414> him a copy<WH6572> of the text<WH3791> of the edict<WH1881> which<WH834> had been issued<WH5414> in Susa<WH7800> for their destruction,<WH8045> that he might show<WH7200> Esther<WH635> and inform<WH5046> her, and to order<WH6680> her to go<WH935> in to the king<WH4428> to implore<WH2603> his favor<WH2603> and to plead<WH1245> with him for her people.<WH5971>
And Hathach<WH2047> came<WH935> back and related<WH5046> Mordecai's words<WH1697> to Esther.<WH635>
Then Esther<WH635> spoke<WH559> to Hathach<WH2047> and ordered<WH6680> him [to reply] to Mordecai: <WH4782>

"All<WH3605> the king<WH4428>'s servants<WH5650> and the people<WH5971> of the king<WH4428>'s provinces<WH4082> know<WH3045> that for any<WH3605> man<WH376> or woman<WH802> who<WH834> comes<WH935> to the king<WH4428> to the inner<WH6442> court<WH2691> who<WH834> is not summoned,<WH7121> he has but one<WH259> law,<WH1881> that he be put<WH4191> to death,<WH4191> unless<WH905> <WH4480> <WH834> the king holds<WH3447> out to him the golden<WH2091> scepter<WH8275> so that he may live.<WH2421> And I have not been summoned<WH7121> to come<WH935> to the king for these<WH2088> thirty<WH7970> days.<WH3117>"
And they related<WH5046> Esther's words<WH1697> to Mordecai.<WH4782>

Then Mordecai<WH4782> told<WH559> [them] to reply<WH7725> to Esther,<WH635> "Do not imagine<WH1819> that you in the king's palace<WH1004> can escape<WH4422> any more<WH4480> than<WH4480> all<WH3605> the Jews.<WH3064>

"For if<WH518> you remain<WH2790> silent<WH2790> at this<WH384> time,<WH6256> relief<WH7305> and deliverance<WH2020> will arise<WH5975> for the Jews<WH3064> from another<WH312> place<WH4725> and you and your father's house<WH1004> will perish. And who<WH6> knows<WH4310> whether<WH3045> you have not attained<WH518> royalty<WH5060> for such a time<WH4438> as this<WH6256>?"
Then Esther<WH635> told<WH559> [them] to reply<WH7725> to Mordecai,<WH4782>

"Go,<WH1980> assemble<WH3664> all<WH3605> the Jews<WH3064> who are found<WH4672> in Susa,<WH7800> and fast<WH6684> for me; do not eat<WH398> or drink<WH8354> for three<WH7969> days,<WH3117> night<WH3915> or day.<WH3117> I and my maidens<WH5291> also<WH1571> will fast<WH6684> in the same<WH3651> way.<WH3651> And thus<WH3651> I will go<WH935> in to the king,<WH4428> which<WH834> is not according to the law;<WH1881> and if<WH834> I perish, I perish."
So Mordecai<WH4782> went<WH5674> away<WH5674> and did<WH6213> just<WH3605> <WH834> as Esther<WH635> had commanded<WH6680> him.
